intro: Ligusticopsis angelicifolia, commonly known as angelicaleaf ligusticopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
